elements.description:
# `<iron-auto-scroll>`

`iron-auto-scroll` is a container for a list of selectable elements, 
the specified `scroll-target` will scroll using smooth animation to the
selected item.

properties.name: attrForSelected
properties.description:
If you want to use an attribute value or property of an element for
`selected` instead of the index, set this to the name of the attribute
or property. Hyphenated values are converted to camel case when used to
look up the property of a selectable element. Camel cased values are
*not* converted to hyphenated values for attribute lookup. It's
recommended that you provide the hyphenated form of the name so that
selection works in both cases. (Use `attr-or-property-name` instead of
`attrOrPropertyName`.)

properties.name: selected
properties.description: Gets or sets the selected element. The default is to use the index of the item.

properties.name: selectedItem
properties.description: Returns the currently selected item.

properties.name: activateEvent
properties.description:
The event that fires from items when they are selected. Selectable
will listen for this event from items and update the selection state.
Set to empty string to listen to no events.

properties.name: selectable
properties.description:
This is a CSS selector string.  If this is set, only items that match the CSS selector
are selectable.

properties.name: selectedClass
properties.description: The class to set on elements when selected.

properties.name: selectedAttribute
properties.description: The attribute to set on elements when selected.

properties.name: fallbackSelection
properties.description:
Default fallback if the selection based on selected with `attrForSelected`
is not found.

properties.name: items
properties.description: The list of items from which a selection can be made.

properties.name: _excludedLocalNames
properties.description:
The set of excluded elements where the key is the `localName`
of the element that will be ignored from the item list.

properties.name: scrollTarget
properties.description:
Specifies the element that will handle the scroll event on the behalf of the current element. This is typically a reference to an element, but there are a few more posibilities: ### Elements id ```html
``` In this case, the `scrollTarget` will point to the outer div element. ### Document scrolling For document scrolling, you can use the reserved word `document`: ```html ``` ### Elements reference ```js appHeader.scrollTarget = document.querySelector('#scrollable-element'); ```

properties.name: _shouldHaveListener
properties.description: True if the event listener should be installed.

properties.name: autoScrollDisabled
properties.description: When true, the scroll target will not scroll automatically to the selected item.

properties.name: noScrollForInitialSelection
properties.description: When true, the scroll feature is disabled for initial selection.

properties.name: scrollDuration
properties.description: The scroll duration (ms) when selected change.

properties.name: autoScrolling
properties.description: Become true during auto-scroll.

properties.name: smoothScrollForInitialSelection
properties.description:
When true, the scroll will occure with smooth animation for initial selection. Note: If this attribute is false
`scrolling` will note become true during the initial scroll to fake the scroll-target was already in this position
when the selection start.

methods.name: indexOf
methods.description: Returns the index of the given item.

return.desc: Returns the index of the item

methods.name: select
methods.description: Selects the given value.

methods.name: selectPrevious
methods.description: Selects the previous item.

methods.name: selectNext
methods.description: Selects the next item.

methods.name: selectIndex
methods.description: Selects the item at the given index.

methods.name: forceSynchronousItemUpdate
methods.description:
Force a synchronous update of the `items` property.

NOTE: Consider listening for the `iron-items-changed` event to respond to
updates to the set of selectable items after updates to the DOM list and
selection state have been made.

WARNING: If you are using this method, you should probably consider an
alternate approach. Synchronously querying for items is potentially
slow for many use cases. The `items` property will update asynchronously
on its own to reflect selectable items in the DOM.

methods.name: _shouldUpdateSelection
methods.description: UNUSED, FOR API COMPATIBILITY

methods.name: _observeItems
methods.description: observe items change under the given node.

methods.name: _scrollHandler
methods.description: Runs on every scroll event. Consumer of this behavior may override this method.

methods.name: _defaultScrollTarget
methods.description:
The default scroll target. Consumers of this behavior may want to customize
the default scroll target.

methods.name: _doc
methods.description: Shortcut for the document element

methods.name: _scrollTop
methods.description: Sets the number of pixels that the content of an element is scrolled upward.

methods.name: _scrollLeft
methods.description: Sets the number of pixels that the content of an element is scrolled to the left.

methods.name: scroll
methods.description: Scrolls the content to a particular place.

methods.name: _scrollTargetWidth
methods.description: Gets the width of the scroll target.

methods.name: _scrollTargetHeight
methods.description: Gets the height of the scroll target.

methods.name: _isValidScrollTarget
methods.description: Returns true if the scroll target is a valid HTMLElement.

methods.name: toggleScrollListener
methods.description: Enables or disables the scroll event listener.

params.name: yes
params.description: True to add the event, False to remove it.

methods.name: smoothScroll
methods.description: Performs a easing scroll animation in the scroll target during which scroll spy is disabled.
